results.title: Country school teacher
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board, Eric Thompson and Shan Benson
results.brief_description: Shows the life and work of a typical country school teacher in a one teacher school near Lismore, NSW. The teacher is shown teaching his varied class, leading them in games, and taking a useful place in the rural community. The film points out that isolation is one the main difficulties for a rural teacher, showing a conference attended by many such teachers to discuss their problems. Photography by George Lowe. Music by the East Lismore school choir.

results.title: country school diary_13
results.brief_description: An anonymous digital dairy created by a young person as part of a day long workshop run by ACMI. Each diary is scripted and a voiceover recorded by the individual young person. Some diaries use photographs brought in by the participant, but the primary visual content is often black and white, ‘stock’ footage of a poetic nature. At no point should the creator or school be positively identified when screening this work.
